DataElement.preferredDefinition: A pathology report provides a description of the gross and microscopic examination of the specimen and is used to make a diagnosis and to determine treatment. Report defines which structures and organs of the body are involved by the tumor, verifies the primary site of the cancer and describes the extent to which it has spread. Essential information to be included in a pathology report: the date and name of the report, slide number, the source of the specimen, the primary tumor size, he histologic diagnosis including the grade or degree of differentiation, the extent of disease within and beyond the primary site._A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.:One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing._Generic value domain for a primitive java dataype that is a long integer (64-bit two's complement).

Concepts.definition: A report that provides a description of the gross and microscopic examination of the specimen and is used to make a diagnosis and to determine treatment. It defines which structures and organs of the body are involved by the tumor, verifies the primary site of the cancer and describes the extent to which it has spread.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: 10.14.20 TL changed WFS from DRAFT NEW to RETIRED ARCHIVED and added an End Date in preparation of OneData.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
